linkTarget.anchoringText: Since 2007, a full-scale strategy has been implemented of completing injector wells with selective injection strings, both in new drilled injectors and in old recompleted wells (Fig 1). Currently, there are over 340 selective injection strings in Casabe with up to 17 isolated injecting sand groups.

image-wrap.label: Figure 1
image-wrap.caption: Production-selective Injection scheme in Casabe field.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Production-selective Injection scheme in Casabe field.

linkTarget.anchoringText: The Casabe field structure is an asymmetrical anticline with moderate dip to the east, affected by transpressional faulting that produced both normal and reverse faults defining the eight operational blocks of the field, as shown in Fig. 2.

image-wrap.label: Figure 2
image-wrap.caption: Casabe field schematic structure form seismic interpretation.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Casabe field schematic structure form seismic interpretation.

linkTarget.anchoringText: Perform a detailed analysis of the contactable fraction (see Fig. 3) for tuning up the analytic model to obtain accurate results.

image-wrap.label: Figure 3
image-wrap.caption: Schematic of contactable fraction in analytical simulation.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Schematic of contactable fraction in analytical simulation.

linkTarget.anchoringText: Tracking injection rate by well and reservoir helped to detect reservoirs that were not achieving the expected injection rates (see Fig. 4). A very detailed analysis was done to review injectivities, petro-physical properties, reservoir pressure, and geological structure. These studies took into account the injection rate history to integrate the analysis with injected pore volumes and remaining reserves.

image-wrap.label: Figure 4
image-wrap.caption: Integration of parameters to select water injection wells for chemical stimulation.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Integration of parameters to select water injection wells for chemical stimulation.

linkTarget.anchoringText: In case the first step was not successful, (see Fig. 5), the WFR valve would be replaced by a full open valve (i.e., valves without the regulation system).

image-wrap.label: Figure 6
image-wrap.caption: Process to analyze pressure data recorded from PDG.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Process to analyze pressure data recorded from PDG.

linkTarget.anchoringText: Casabe presents a unique opportunity in this regard. The injector well network around the field can be used to get pressure data by deploying gauges within the injection mandrels of the tubing string. These sensors are derived from standard gas lift technology but modified to measure formation pressure. (See Fig 7.)
The global goal of the project was achieved, as shown in Fig. 8.

image-wrap.label: Figure 8
image-wrap.caption: Production and injection performance during the implementation of water injection optimization methodology.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Production and injection performance during the implementation of water injection optimization methodology.

linkTarget.anchoringText: Production decreased despite drilling and starting the production of new producers. Refer to Fig. A-1. Blocks VII and VIII show a number of challenges, which were classified as follows:

image-wrap.label: Figure A-1
image-wrap.caption: Production and water injection performance in blocks VII and VIII.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Production and water injection performance in blocks VII and VIII.

linkTarget.anchoringText: The methodology takes as input an analytic simulation that integrates the static model for blocks VII and VIII static model, pressure/volume/temperature (PVT) and petrophysics studies, and produced fluid’s history matching. This analytic simulation references classical theories like Buckley-Leverett or Dykstra Parsons, as technical support, and these are coupled with Monte Carlo analysis to calculate volumetric and displacement efficiencies and reserves, as shown in Fig. A-2.

image-wrap.label: Figure A-2
image-wrap.caption: Remaining oil by reservoir in blocks VII and VIII.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Remaining oil by reservoir in blocks VII and VIII.

linkTarget.anchoringText: Calculate injection rate by reservoir, establishing an injected pore volume target to obtain an oil production forecast; refer to Fig. A-3 to see the process step by step.

In case both steps 1 and 2 were not successful, an RST active silice log (refer to Fig. A-4) would be run to discard a possible sanding problem in the mandrel (i.e., sediment accumulation in the annulus between the tubing and casing blocking the perforations).

Chemical stimulation in selected wells was done using coiled tubing with inflatable packers following the consecutive treatment. Refer to Fig. A-5 for injectivity test comparison before and after chemical stimulation.

image-wrap.label: Figure A-5
image-wrap.caption: Injectivity test comparison before and after chemical stimulation job.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Injectivity test comparison before and after chemical stimulation job.

linkTarget.anchoringText: This application enabled identifying reservoir properties such as channeling, formation damage, and reservoir limits, as shown in Fig. A-6.

A general workflow for the tuning of ALS capacity is shown (Fig. A-7). First, the confirmation of the necessity of updating the ALS capacity is important. Usually, it comes with a well with higher than normal fluid levels. Nonetheless, it may occur that a low level indicates the requirement for lowering the lift capacity of a certain well.

Therefore, their remaining oil is not very significant. Currently, their contribution to production is very low, mostly water. Therefore, actions to isolate these reservoirs should be taken either in water injectors, by installing dummies in the corresponding mandrels, and well producers, if possible. The target reservoirs are A2, B1, and B2; hence, the exploitation strategy for blocks VII and VIII changed. Instead of producing 20 reservoirs, the new target is 10 reservoirs.

image-wrap.label: Figure B-1
image-wrap.caption: Analytic model forecast vs. actual oil production in chosen patterns.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Analytic model forecast vs. actual oil production in chosen patterns.

linkTarget.anchoringText: Therefore, their remaining oil is not very significant. Currently, their contribution to production is very low, mostly water. Therefore, actions to isolate these reservoirs should be taken either in water injectors, by installing dummies in the corresponding mandrels, and well producers, if possible. The target reservoirs are A2, B1, and B2; hence, the exploitation strategy for blocks VII and VIII changed. Instead of producing 20 reservoirs, the new target is 10 reservoirs.

image-wrap.label: Figure B-2
image-wrap.caption: Example of oil increase in surrounding pattern due to new configuration of injector wells based on water optimization calculations.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Example of oil increase in surrounding pattern due to new configuration of injector wells based on water optimization calculations.

linkTarget.anchoringText: Nearby injector wells were considered for lowering the pressure gauge, and CSBE0002 was selected since according to up-to-date geological model there was no reason to speculate for the existence of any pressure barrier between this and CSBE-0001 in sands A2 (Fig. B-3). The sensor was finally deployed, and the measured pressure was approximately 2700 psi. As conclusion, we can see that the sand between the injectors was at least partly disconnected since a severe pressure difference was measured.

image-wrap.label: Figure B-3
image-wrap.caption: Information analysis for dummies with pressure sensor.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Information analysis for dummies with pressure sensor.

linkTarget.anchoringText: The production logging Y-tool was successfully run in well CSBE-0004 (Fig. B-4). Nonetheless, extend its implementation to other wells is not possible due to its high cost.

image-wrap.label: Figure B-4
image-wrap.caption: Production logging test with Y-tool results.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Production logging test with Y-tool results.
